title: Fragment, 16th–17th century
medium:
Medium: silk, metal foil applied to parchment core
Technique: plain compound weave
provenance: ex. coll. Antonio Vives y Escudero
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 16.2 x 19.7 cm (6 3/8 x 7 3/4 in.)
description: Close design of hunters: striding man with a raised club, prowling lion, and a man on horseback with raised scimitar.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fragment, 16th–17th century.
16th–17th century. Medium: silk, metal foil applied to parchment core
Technique: plain compound weave. Gift of John Pierpont Morgan. 1902-1-402.
